comment: This was one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. There are 10/12 discussions for the whole year but you only have to do 5 of them and the extras are dropped. There are weekly quizzes. The midterm and final count heavily on your grade but there is no excuse to not get an A. 10/10 would take again.
Don't register in this course. There was a ton of reading material, and the test was difficult. Please take someone else if you are able to.

I honestly loved this professor. I felt like the homework was pretty easy even though the tests were very heavy. She also gave us lots of opportunities to get our grades up and provided good feedback to our discussion answers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Super easy class and amazing professor. She has her class planned out and set up so that all her students will do good. You pick 5 of 14 discussion/worksheets for the whole semester, easy quizzes in the textbook, and just a midterm and final exam. No lockdown or anything! Take her if you can.

This class is pretty easy. There are optional weekly assignments and you only have to do five of them overall. Most of the workload in this class is on Revel, which is not included in KSU's book fees. It is around 75 dollars so be ready to drop more money on a book.

Prof. Hutcheson is great! There's a lot of reading, but that's a given of any communications course. She provided lots of opportunities for extra credit, and all the assignments allowed us to be creative and share about ourselves. I'll definitely miss her weekly posts, usually with a comic or some encouragement sprinkled in. :)

This class is super easy, with maybe an hour max of homework every week (with the exception of midterm/final exam week). Hutcheson was pretty accessible and understanding with her students even in an asynchronous course. Definitely, an easy A if you just do the revel quizzes (Quizlet is helpful with these). I didn't learn much but it's a gen-ed.

easy class! she is very nice and the content was interesting. it is info that you can actually use in life. few assignments. textbook reading is mandatory but manageable. there is a midterm and a final and some easy weekly textbook quizzes. I was only online because of covid and the class was a good online class to have

The class isn't too difficult and the workload isn't too hefty. Simple enough assignments. You have assignments every week but they really don't take too long. Easy class as long as you follow due dates. The teacher is pretty nice, so that is nice.

Dr. Hutcheson gave a lot of weekly lecture videos and assignments that were not always worth credit, but helped a lot come test time. There were 2 easy papers, and she graded them very generously. The exams were difficult but not impossible. Not sure why she has such bad reviews because this was a reasonable class graded generously. Take her!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: DO NOT TAKE!! Weekly assignments with no directions. Tests are extremely difficult and a lot of short answer. Not very helpful. Rude over email. Save yourself and take ANYONE else!!

Literally the worst teacher I've ever taken. Her class is easy until your finally training manual and I hope you like guessing on what to do. We were suppose to be a 3 hour class and it got changed to a hybrid. The only way she could have been a worse teacher is having her for three hours. The worst teacher I had in my 5 years at KSU

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. I withdrew from this class hoping that KSU would bring another professor in to teach it or offer something else to take it's place. Very unorganized. Self-Contradicting, argues with students, the list goes on.

I took Professor Hutcheson online for Comm Theory, and it was such a mistake. The weekly assignments and video lecture had very little correlation with graded assignments, and the tests were impossibly hard.  There are two papers weren't hard if you're a good writer, but she is  a seriously tough grader. I put hours of work into her class weekly.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took Professor Hutcheson online for Comm Theory, and she was the worst. The weekly assignments and video lecture have little correlation with graded assignments, and the tests were impossibly hard.  There are two papers weren't hard if you're a good writer, but she is  a seriously tough grader. DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU WANT AN A!!!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Lots of small assignments (all easy though). A TON of reading. A few tests (kind of hard). And two big papers (the hardest part of the semester). Don't procrastinate. Study hard. Get ready to work for your grade.

Hutcheson is a sweet lady who is knowledgeable about the material, but she is not a very good teacher at all. She assigns lots of weekly work that doesn't supplement the actual material. She is VERY unorganized. Her syllabus and due dates are extremely unclear and half the time you are unsure about what is actually due. She's an easy grader though.

Three major group projects, HOPE TO GOD that your team mates are not idiots. She will keep you busy all semester. All exams are online. There are a couple of discussions. Make sure you know APA citations and do them right the first time (20 pts deduction otherwise). Hardcore grading. DO THE STUDY GUIDES! Very helpful for the tests.

I took this during the summer as a hybrid. Overall I got a good grade and the teacher is very sweet. However, I, along with my classmates, felt that things were never clear. We would have assignments due that we didn't know about, and it just wasn't clear every what we were doing. Also, the workload is a lot. Tests are easy, but lots of work.

She's a really nice person. She reopened a test for our class because we didn't do well enough on it and she wanted us to succeed. She's so understanding. She's not great at D2L though, probably because she's really old.

THE BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD!!! She is absolutely adorable and so sweet! She makes the classroom feel very laid back and chill-which is GREAT for a public speaking class. She gives a LOT of opportunities to raise your grade and keeps class interesting and fun! Never boring. The midterm and final are IDENTICAL to the study guide.TAKE HER- EASY A
Dr. Hutcheson is very nice, and she can explain the material very well, here only problems is that she can be confusing when giving directions on what needs to be done.
